article.headline: McNeese St. 66, Louisiana-Monroe 57
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. -- P.J. Alawoya scored 15 of his 17 points in the second half and grabbed nine rebounds to lead McNeese State to a 66-57 win over Louisiana-Monroe on Saturday. The Cowboys (4-3) defeated the Warhawks (2-6) for the second time this season. McNeese State won 82-63 on Nov. 20 at Louisiana-Monroe. Both teams struggled from the field to begin the game, but McNeese State built a 21-6 lead with 5:30 left in the first half. The Warhawks rallied to trail 27-16 at halftime. McNeese State made 17 of 27 shots in the second half (63 percent). Stephan Martin and Patrick Richard added 12 points apiece for the Cowboys. The Warhawks have lost four straight games and have not won a road game since February. Rudy Turner led Louisiana-Monroe with 19 points while Lawrence Gilbert had his first career double-double with 18 points and 10 rebounds.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
